name: Twin
desc: The Traveler's twin, Princess/Prince of Khaenri'ah, Savior, and the Princess/Prince of the Abyss Order.

customize.text: Relationships

customize.name: Traveler
customize.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

customize.text: Lumine/Aether is the Traveler's twin. Their homeworld was destroyed, and they were traveling among the stars for a long time until they came to Teyvat on a spaceship. Lumine/Aether woke up first without any memories of the twin.

After Lumine/Aether woke up, King Irmin of Khaenri'ah used her/him as a vessel for the Abyss. People believed that the golden-haired heir would lead them to power. Lumine/Aether became the Princess/Prince of Khaenri'ah and considers the kingdom her/his second homeland.

customize.name: Khaenri'ahn cataclysm
customize.desc: A disaster that occurred 500 years ago. The Abyss was released into Teyvat and Khaenri'ah was destroyed.

customize.text:
Once, the Sage, who knows all the world's secrets, prophesied the end of the world and the appearance of the Savior. The Princess/Prince of Khaenri'ah was to become this Savior. During the Cataclysm, she/he faced a difficult choice: to save the twin or the kingdom, and she/he chose the twin.
Direidyth
During the Cataclysm, a girl named Direidyth found Lumine/Aether and claimed that her/his twin was looking for her/him. To prove her words, the girl showed the key to the hibernation chamber, but when Lumine/Aether found the twin, the key was still with him/her.

customize.name: Istaroth
customize.desc: Ruler of Time, also known as Tokoyo Ookami, "the thousand winds of time," and Kairos, "the ruler of the unchanging world." She is one of the shades of the Primordial One.

customize.text: The Ruler of Time, presumably, is responsible for the time anomaly that allowed the Traveler and the Princess/Prince of Khaenri'ah to meet during the Cataclysm. As a result, Lumine/Aether left Khaenri'ah and went to save the twin, who still hadn't woken up. Because of the anomaly, Direidyth and Princess/Prince's twin met after 500 years, and he/she gave the key to the girl from the future to the past.

customize.name: Asmoday
customize.desc: A sustainer of Heavenly Principles, who separated the Traveler and their twin, and one of the four shades.

customize.text: When the Princess/Prince woke up the twin, they tried to leave Teyvat, but were stopped by the Unknown God, who separated them again. The Princess/Prince continued her/his journey, while the sibling's journey started only 500 years later.

customize.name: Dainsleif
customize.desc: A former captain of the Khaenri'ahn Royal Guard, who was cursed by Celestia with immortality.

customize.text: After the Cataclysm, the Princess/Prince embarked on a journey with the Royal Guard Captain, Dainsleif. They eventually went on their separate ways, and the Princess/Prince began to consider Dainsleif an enemy.

customize.name: Chlothar
customize.desc: A pure-blood Khaenri'ahn who was cursed with immortality by Celestia. He is a member of the Alberich Clan and the founder of the Abyss Order.

customize.text: During her/his travels in Sumeru, Lumine/Aether met with Chlothar Alberich, a pure-blooded Khaenri'ahn cursed with immortality. After their meeting, Lumine/Aether started thinking about using the power of the Abyss and of creating the Loom of Fate.

customize.name: Abyss Order
customize.desc: An organization comprised of the cursed Khaenri'ahns and non-human monsters. They are the enemies of surface civilization and thrive in many corners of the world. Their main goal is to destroy the world under the rule of The Seven.

customize.text: Chlothar Alberich founded the Abyss Order, and after he disappeared, Lumine/Aether became the Princess/Prince of the Order. The organization consists of the cursed Khaenri'ahns and non-human monsters. They are the enemies of surface civilization and thrive in many corners of the world. Their main goal is to destroy the world under the rule of The Seven and revive Khaenri'ah.

customize.name: Loom of Fate
customize.desc: A device created by the Abyss Order that is capable of weaving Ley Lines. Using the Loom of Fate, the Atlas of the New World was created — reconstructed Ley Lines of New Khaenri'ah based on the memories of 500 years ago.

customize.text: A mechanism designed by the Abyss Order that is capable of weaving the Ley Lines. The Princess/Prince asked

customize.name: Yohualtecuhtin, Lord of the Night
customize.desc: An angel who created the Night Kingdom in Natlan.

customize.text: to create the new Khaenri'ahn Ley Lines from the memories of 500 years ago.

customize.name: Aranara
customize.desc: Greater Lord Rukkhadevata's familiars and spirits of the forest.

customize.text: The Aranara call the Traveler's twin Nara Varuna or the golden Nara. 500 years ago, she/he helped to heal the Varuna Contraption, defeat the monsters, and save the Sumeru forest.
Related Quests
Related Items

customize.name: Traveler
customize.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

customize.text: Character Story

<color=#ffd780>Character Story 1</color>
A boy and a girl stood amidst the tumult, under an unfamiliar sky.
You were a pair of traveling twins, passing through countless worlds during your journey.
Descending upon a continent named Teyvat, you hoped that you would be able to enjoy your time here.
But as you awoke among the falling stars, you saw the world in turmoil, a cataclysm raging across the land...
You sought to leave this place and move on to the next world, but then an unknown god stood before you, barring the way.
This deity was spotless, floating over a world of chaos.
Looking down on you.
The god took your only kin away, and you were sealed and cast into a deep slumber filled with nightmares...
When you reawakened, the world was changed.
The flames of war raged no longer, and nothing was left that looked familiar.
How long had you been asleep? You had no answers.
Thus, you began a lonely journey, seeking the deity that you had once laid eyes upon...
<color=#ffd780>Character Story 2</color>
After that, you met Paimon, and wandered together for some time.
You learned that this world has seven deities who rule the seven nations as the Seven Archons.
Your first stop was the free city of wine and song, Mondstadt, a city built by the Anemo Archon.
As you stepped into Mondstadt as an outlander, it was, as the other nations were, beset on both sides by non-human and human threats.
The non-human threat was comprised of the confederacy known as the Abyss Order.
The human threat, on the other hand stemmed, from the ambition of the Tsaritsa, god of Snezhnaya.
The Abyss Order had corrupted an ally of the Anemo Archon, the Dragon of the East of the Four Winds of Mondstadt.
The envoys of Snezhnaya, for their part, used this opposition to the Abyss as an excuse to put pressure on Mondstadt.
These threats from without and within caused the return of the Anemo Archon, who took on the form of a bard and joined you in your journey to save the dragon.
Yet there was something then that you did not see — for as the dragon fell to the Abyss, a certain figure had been reflected in its eyes...
The one who rules the Abyss.
He/She had once traveled with you, and you had once crossed many worlds together.
<color=#ffd780>Character Story 3</color>
Though you made no promises, though it was an "agreement" the other party made one-sidedly,
You nonetheless set out on a sojourn across the Seven Nations to reach "the journey's end."
It would be a stretch to call this a pleasant path — as your feet took you forward, you witnessed and were pulled into the crises each nation faced...
Perhaps this is no coincidence. Perhaps some tremendous tremor deeper beneath the world is to blame for the waves of catastrophe.
The Tsaritsa's plan to collect the Gnoses persists apace, while the terrifying force corrupting the world awaits opportunities to strike.
And the Abyss Order, the organization led by your own flesh and blood...
From the Loom of Fate operational launch to the Atlas of the New World's completion, you know deep down that their actions are changing the fate of this world.
As you gradually understand said world, you have also come to understand the things your sister/brother...
But this has not made your journey any easier, nor your footsteps lighter. That was not what you expected at first.
Dialogues

<color=#ffd780>About the Abyss</color>
I think this is my memory.
Of emptiness. That's the power of the Abyss.
Because I will always remember...
...That the Abyss took my twin away.
(The Abyss... It's always bad news.)
(The purpose of my journey is to find you. I will keep going, and imagine a better tomorrow with you.)
(Okay, I have to get everyone out of here. I'll find a way to survive this... then find the lost treasure.)

customize.name: Paimon
customize.desc: The Traveler's best friend and Teyvat guide.

customize.text: Dialogues

<color=#ffd780>About the twin</color>
First off, that Abyss Herald called your sister/brother "Princess/Prince."
It seems like your sister/brother is leading the Abyss Order, even the Abyss Herald answers to her/him... Still, we don't know for sure if she/he's the highest-ranking leader in the organization.
Also, your sister/brother said that she/he wants to "engulf the thrones" and go to "war with destiny." What the heck does that mean? ...Could it be that she/he wants to destroy The Seven and the seven nations?
Next thing... turns out the Abyss Order monsters are really what the people of Khaenri'ah turned into after their nation was destroyed. This story is just plain terrifying!
And Dain is from Khaenri'ah, too! He witnessed its destruction 500 years ago. But... he didn't turn into a monster, and now he's fighting the Abyss Order...
So that's why your sister/brother said that Dain is her/his enemy, right?
But... If the monsters of the Abyss are the same people that Dain protected all those years ago, then why is he enemies with the Abyss Order now?
Also, how come... after all this time we've spent searching for your sister/brother, it turns out she/he's on the side of the Abyss. What's up with that?

customize.name: Traveler
customize.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

customize.name: Paimon
customize.desc: The Traveler's best friend and Teyvat guide.

customize.text: Voice-Over

<color=#ffd780>About Nightmares</color>
<color=#37ffff>Paimon:</color> Have you ever had one of those super scary nightmares, Traveler?
<color=#37ffff>Traveler:</color> Um, I've dreamed of falling through endless darkness...
<color=#37ffff>Traveler:</color> Without a wind glider.
<color=#37ffff>Paimon:</color> Eek...
<color=#37ffff>Traveler:</color> I've also dreamed of my sister/brother walking away from me, while I'm unable to catch up to her/him no matter fast I run.
<color=#37ffff>Traveler:</color> ...She/He tells me that I've "come too late."
<color=#37ffff>Paimon:</color> Oh...
<color=#37ffff>Paimon:</color> Yours are quite different from the ones that Paimon's had.
<color=#37ffff>Paimon:</color> Paimon's scariest dream was being eaten by a super giant slime.
Dialogues

<color=#ffd780>About the Traveler and the twin</color>
<color=#37ffff>Paimon</color> : So... what you're trying to say is that you fell here... from another world?
<color=#37ffff>Paimon</color> : But when you wanted to leave, and go on to the next world, your path was blocked by some unknown god?
<color=#37ffff>Traveler</color> : And just like that, the god took away my sister/brother‍.
<color=#37ffff>Traveler</color> : Some kind of seal was cast upon me, and I lost my power. So while we used to travel from world to world, we are now trapped here.
<color=#37ffff>Traveler</color> : How many years ago was it? I don't know...
<color=#37ffff>Traveler</color> : But I intend to find out.

customize.name: Dainsleif
customize.desc: A former captain of the Khaenri'ahn Royal Guard, who was cursed by Celestia with immortality.

customize.text: Dialogues

<color=#ffd780>About the Savior</color>
The Vinster King and the entire Court of Khaenri'ah set about loudly proclaiming the might that she/he would bring to the nation.
They made it sound as if with her/him there, all pain and suffering would be washed away, and the future of Khaenri'ah would be brighter than anyone could imagine...
"The Savior" was the celebratory title given to the Princess/Prince by those who believed this rhetoric.
Of course, you know how that story ended. In hindsight, the cruel irony is glaring. All that title really stood for was the Vinster King's lust for power.

customize.name: Chlothar
customize.desc: A pure-blood Khaenri'ahn who was cursed with immortality by Celestia. He is a member of the Alberich Clan and the founder of the Abyss Order.

customize.text: Dialogues

<color=#ffd780>About the Abyssal powers</color>
I never imagined that you, of all people, would deny the Abyss... How ridiculous!
We once believed that you would bring new strength and hope to Khaenri'ah.
To us, you were the Abyss... A wondrous mystery far beyond our imagination and comprehension...
...And the one who controls the Abyss can control everything!
We yearned for that future. We looked to you to take us there.
But what did you bring us instead?
O Princess/Prince... of Khaenri'ah?
Haden
Dialogues

<color=#ffd780>About the Abyss Order's plans</color>
Then, allow me to be frank. As far as we are concerned... Our Princess/Prince has already won by other means.
And I do not merely mean this battle. No, Her/His Highness has achieved something far greater...
...For today, the Abyss Order's greatest wish has finally been fulfilled.
The Abyss Order's greatest wish?
Our Highness quietly infiltrated the Night Kingdom to exploit that realm's past experience with Ley Line reconstruction...
And then used the Loom of Fate... to re-weave the Ley Lines of Khaenri'ah.
As of now, our homeland has been revived...
